context.p: You can change the name of a declared internal entity (but not its content).
To change an internal entity declaration, do the following:

step.cmd: Call up the Internal Subset Entities Dialog.

info.p: To call up the Internal Subset Entities Dialog, do one of the following:

choice.p: Right-click any entity reference in the ContentMap and select Entity Declarations from the context menu.

stepresult.p: The Internal Subset Entities Dialog will appear. The left Choose Entity pane of the dialog shows the list of internal and external entities declared in the document.

note.p: Only internal DTD subset entity declarations may be modified.

step.cmd: Select the subtree of internal entities.

info.p: To select the subtree of internal entities, click the Internal subtree.
To choose an internal entity, click the internal entity's name in the Internal subtree.

stepresult.p: The right Entity Content pane of the dialog shows the content of the chosen internal entity in plain text.

step.cmd: Call up the Change Internal Entity Name Dialog.

info.p: To call up the Change Internal Entity Name Dialog, click the Change button.

stepresult.p: The Change Internal Entity Name Dialog will appear.

step.cmd: Specify the new name of the internal entity.

info.p: In the Entity Name field, enter the new name of the internal entity.
To change the name of the internal entity, click OK.

fig.title: A new name of the internal entity specified. Click OK.

stepresult.p: If there is no entity with the same name in the internal DTD subset, the entity name will be changed. This change will affect all references to this entity.
